Richard Szeliski Image Stitching 56
Rotational mosaic
• Projection equations
1. Project from image to 3D ray
• (x0,y0,z0) = (u0-uc,v0-vc,f)
2. Rotate the ray by camera motion
• (x1,y1,z1) = R01 (x0,y0,z0)
3. Project back into new (source) image
• (u1,v1) = (fx1/z1+uc,fy1/z1+vc)

Computing homography
• Assume we have four matched points: How do we compute homography H?
Normalized DLT
1. Normalize coordinates for each image
a) Translate for zero mean
b) Scale so that average distance to origin is ~sqrt(2)
– This makes problem better behaved numerically
